page.title: 12Transport in Moy
page.content: Most people have their own transport. Buses run from Inverness to Newtonmore with a few stops. There are three buses passing each way through Moy during weekdays. No Sunday service. The Railway Station opened in 1896 _ closed in 1966. The Railway Station house is now a Guest House. The Station Master's house is now a private home. The A9, the old A9, the old old A9. In 1977/78 the new A9 from Inverness to Perth was completed. This cut a lot of traffic from the old A9 which runs through Moy and is now mostly used by local people and as an alternative tourist route. A small part of the original A9 remains _ this old old A9 runs alongside Loch Moy and is used by the Forestry Commission and children cycling to school.
